text.p: You are given a dictionary aDict that maps integer keys to string values. Write a Python function called unique_values that returns a list of the integer keys in aDict that map to string values that appear exactly once in aDict.
This function takes in a dictionary and returns a list. It returns the list of keys in increasing order.

ul.li: If aDict does not contain any values appearing exactly once, return an empty list.
If aDict is empty, return an empty list.
If aDict = {1:'a',2:'b',3:'c',4:'c',5:'d'} then your function returns [1,2,5].
If aDict = {1:'a',2:'a',3:'a'} then your function returns []

text.pre: def unique_values(aDict): ''' aDict: a dictionary that maps ints to strings Returns a sorted list of the keys that map to unique aDict values, empty list if no keys ''' # YOUR CODE HERE
text.p: Paste your entire function, including the definition, in the box below. Do not leave any print statements.
